page.title: 05PRAWN FISHING,ULLAPOOL.
page.content: Approximately 24 local,creel boats, 25-45 feet in length,fish out of Ullapool.The fleet works up to 1000 creels each for nephrops(prawns).The herring or mackerel baited creels,set in fleets of about 60,are lifted and reset daily on a muddy seabed,at various depths.The area fished is from inside Loch Broom to The Minch. Most prawns leave,by lorry,from Ullapool to a processing factory in Gairloch where the large ones are blast-frozen whole and the smaller ones are peeled,glazed and frozen, mostly for sale in Europe. Problems may arise in the klondyking season if:a)they drag anchor in rough weather fouling creels b)trawlers net creels while fishing c)mackerel pro- cessing debris pollutes prawn grounds, causing concern to prawn fishermen. Prawn landings-1984-300t.Value-Â£551476
